CANDROP_DISTANCE - Static variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.ReturnHome
Distance that the robot travels within the starting corner before off-loading the cans.
CanLocator - Class in ca.mcgill.ecse211.model
This class allows the EV3 to search for cans and identify their colors and weights.
CanLocator(Robot, AssessCanColor, AssessCanWeight, Clamp, SampleProvider, float[], Navigation, LightLocalizer) - Constructor for class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.CanLocator
This is the default constructor of this class.
checkCan(double) - Method in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.CanLocator
checkCan() returns true if a can was spotted by the ultrasonic sensor within the range of a tile.
clamp - Variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.CanLocator
 
Clamp - Class in ca.mcgill.ecse211.model
This class is responsible for driving the clamp motor to load and unload the can.

This is the default constructor of this class.

ColorClassification - Class in ca.mcgill.ecse211.model
This class implements color classification to identify the color of the cans.
ColorClassification(float[], SampleProvider) - Constructor for class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.ColorClassification
Constructor to initialize variables.
colorData - Variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.ColorClassification
 
colorID - Variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.ColorClassification
 
COLOUR_DIFF - Static variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.LightLocalizer
As the robot spins and the color sensor records the brightness of the playing field, if a percent change in brightness that is greater than this value (i.e., 20%) is recorded, then the robot knows that a grid line has been detected.
convertAngle(double, double, double) - Static method in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.Navigation
This method converts a rotation in place into the total rotation (in degrees) of each wheel needed to cause that rotation.
convertDistance(double, double) - Static method in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.Navigation
This method converts a distance into the total rotation (in degrees) of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
CRITICAL_DISTANCE - Static variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.UltrasonicLocalizer
As the robot spins, the ultrasonic sensor detects this distance (cm) twice and, based on the odometer's recorded angles at those instances, calculations are made to make the robot face North (i.e., 0 degrees).
CS_FRONT_PORT - Static variable in class ca.mcgill.ecse211.main.Project
